momentary_layer.description: Temporary turn on layer {{layer}} if the key is being pressed

toggle_layer.description: Permanently turn on or off layer {{layer}}

bottom_layer.description: Set layer {{layer}} as the default (bottom) layer

layer_tap.description: {{key}} when pressed, temporary turn on layer {{layer}} when long pressed

bootloader.description: Reboot the keyboard to Recovery mode

recalibrate.description: Recalibrate (takes a few seconds, do not touch the keys during this time)

toggle_profile.description: Switch between the current profile and the previous profile

toggle_profile_0.description: Switch between the current profile and profile 1

do_i_need_calibration.message: Usually not needed. Calibration is only required when changing switches with different magnetic strengths.
do_i_need_calibration.title: Do I need to calibrate?

calibration.hint_no_keys_selected: Please select the key you want to calibrate first.

how_to_calibrate.message:
Select keys you need to calibrate and click the start button.
Press the button all the way down, then release it.
Click the Finish button (displayed after starting calibration) to save the calibration results.
how_to_calibrate.title: How to do the calibration?

auto_calibration.title: Runtime calibration
auto_calibration.description: Performs self-calibration continuously during operation to ensure stability and accuracy. This feature cannot be disabled.

full_calibration.title: Clear values recorded by Runtime calibration
full_calibration.description: Clear values recorded by Runtime calibration. For keyboards that support multiple layouts, it will also re-detect the layout in use.

bottom_calibration.title: Manually calibrate relative bottom-out value
bottom_calibration.description: When a key is pressed forcefully, subsequent presses with normal force may behave abnormally. This issue becomes more apparent with very low settings. This step addresses it by recording relative values from presses with normal force.
bottom_calibration.clear: Clear saved values for selected keys

steps.title: Please follow the steps below:
steps.step1: Firmly press down the switch. This is because transportation may have loosened the switch. If this step is not ensured, any issue may occur.
steps.step2: If you have already forcefully pressed the key, first perform 'Clear runtime calibration values' to remove the automatically recorded bottom-out value.
steps.step3: If the key already has a calibration value, clear it first.
steps.step5: Without selecting any keys, press the key you want to calibrate with normal force. Try to press straight down during the process. Avoid pressing too hard.
steps.step6: Select these keys and click Save.

bottom_calibration.hint_change_switch_requires_redo:
Calibration values recorded previously will become invalid after changing the switch model. You need to redo this process.
Even with the same switch model, re-calibration is required to account for individual differences.
bottom_calibration.hint_no_keys_selected: Please select the key you want to save the calibration value first.

dialog_failed.title: Key not pressed or switch improperly installed
dialog_failed.description:
Please make sure you have pressed the key with normal force. Do not attempt to save without pressing it at all.

If you have replaced the switch yourself, please ensure it is firmly installed. Even slight looseness that is visually hard to detect can have a significant impact on keyboard performance. Transportation may also cause minor loosening of the switch.

bottom_calibration.hint_unnecessary_keys_are_disabled: Keys that do not require 'Manually calibrate relative bottom-out value' are disabled.

calibration.hint_during_this_hint: While you are seeing this prompt
calibration.hint_dont_touch_keys: Please do not touch the keys.
calibration.hint_keys_disabled: The keyboard will now not output key values to the operating system.

hint.device_is_in_use: The device is in use. Please check if you have connected the device on another web page or app.
hint.no_device_selected:
No device selected.

For PomPomBoard and other devices with firmware version lower than 0.4.0, please use {{ legacy_site }}.
hint.no_webhid_support: Your browser does not support WebHID. Please use the latest version of Chrome or Edge browser.
hint.legacy_site: the old version of the website
hint.firmware_outdated: The firmware of the device is no longer supported. Please update the firmware to the latest version.
hint.configurator_outdated: This version of the configurator does not support the firmware of the device. Please update the configurator to the latest version.
hint.device_in_recovery_mode: Device is in recovery mode. If the last firmware upgrade was not completed, please re-plug the device and try upgrading the firmware again.

debug.title: Debug
debug.hint_hurt_performance: Staying on this tab will affect performance.

re_initialize.message: Redo the steps that to be performed when powering on, including but not limited to calibration, check if switches are installed. For keyboards that support multiple layouts, which layout is installed will also be rechecked.
re_initialize.title: Reinitialize
re_initialize.warning: Do not touch the keys within a few seconds of starting re-initialization.

enable_log.title: Enable log
enable_log.description: Enable log output. This is useful for debugging. Check the log in Devices - Logs. This option is disabled by default and is not saved in the device.

reset.title: Reset
reset.description: Reset the configuration of the device to default. Please wait for about half a minute before unplugging the device to ensure the configuration is saved.

test_matrix.title: Reports whether the key is pressed
test_matrix.description: Allows the keyboard to report whether a key is considered to be pressed. Pressed keys are indicated by the visual above. This option is disabled by default and is not saved in the device.

reboot.title: Reboot to Recovery Mode
reboot.description: Reboot the device into recovery mode. Normally, you don't need to use this. If triggered by mistake, simply reconnect the device to recover.

button.title: Try it out
button.summary: Explore the device's features and capabilities through demo mode without purchasing the device. Start now!

information.title: Information
information.host_operation_system: Host operation system (fetched by the device)

hint.not_a_valid_firmware: This is not a valid firmware file.
hint.mismatched_firmware: The firmware file does not match the device.
hint.upgrade_was_interrupted: The upgrade process was interrupted. Please replug the device and try again.
hint.firmware_interrupted: The firmware upgrade was interrupted. Please replug the device and try again.
hint.device_not_connected: Device not connected or the device is already in recovery mode.

firmware.dev_channel_warning: The dev channel firmware contains the latest features, but has only been lightly tested. If you don't know how to handle issues, please do not use it.
firmware.nightly_channel_warning: The nightly channel firmware contains the real latest changes, but only the developer tests it very roughly.
firmware.reboot_to_recovery: Reboot the device to recovery mode
firmware.reboot_to_recovery_hint: After restarting to recovery mode, the device will prompt the user that the device is in recovery mode by means of a indicator light.
firmware.connect_to_recovery_device: Connect to device in recovery mode
firmware.connect_to_recovery_device_hint: After clicking Connect, you need to select the device again and the writing process will begin. If you want to give up on upgrading, please DO NOT click Connect. The device will return to normal mode after replugging the device.
firmware.connect_to_recovery_device_hint_unable_t: If the device cannot be found, make sure it is in recovery mode. For example, typing should not be possible. Also, using a low-quality USB cable may prevent the device from running at USB 2.0 High Speed and thus not be detected.
firmware.flash_firmware_hint: Please do not disconnect the device. If the device is disconnected during flashing, the device will stay in recovery mode and can be restored by re-upgrading the firmware.
firmware.firmware_upgrade_finished: Update successes. The window will automatically close.
firmware.device_already_in_recovery: The device is already in recovery mode

update_found.title: Update found for your device
update_found.description: Your device is running firmware version {{currentVersion}}. The latest version is {{latestVersion}}.

keymap.hint_no_keys_selected: Please select the key you want to remap first.
keymap.hint_combo_is_empty: Please choose at least one key or modifier for the combo.
keymap.hint_tap_hold_key_not_supported: This setup requires a newer version of firmware.
keymap.hint_tap_hold_tap_is_not_valid: Key for tap should be a normal key.
keymap.hint_tap_hold_key_is_same: Tap and hold keys cannot be the same.

combination.name: Combo
combination.summary: Trigger the shortcut you want by a single tap
combination.text: A key combination is a combination of one or more modifier keys (e.g. Ctrl, Shift) and a regular key.

dynamic.limit: Cannot add more configs for this key
dynamic.name: Dynamic Key
dynamic.placeholder: Select a key from below to add to the config...

normal.name: Normal
normal.text: Select the key you want to remap and click on the key below.

tap_hold.name: Tap Hold
tap_hold.text:
Tap and long presses correspond to different keys.

The keys for long presses can also be switching layer, which greatly expands the possibilities of the keyboard.

It takes time to determine if it's a press, triggering the "tap" key will be slower than a normal key. Enabling Rapid Trigger for this key and lowering the reset distance will improve it, but it is still not as good as a normal key.

intermittent.name: Intermittent
intermittent.text: Simulate a long key press as intermittent key presses.

performance.hint_the_value_is_too_aggressive: Since the switch and human hands cannot be absolutely stable, overly aggressive settings may result in abnormal key triggering. To pursue the limit, we recommend that you find an extreme but stable value that suits you by continuously increasing the value of the setting.

rapid_trigger.title: Rapid Trigger
rapid_trigger.description: After enabling Rapid Trigger, the trigger and reset position are no longer fixed, but dynamically adjusted as you press. This allows you to trigger or reset keys more quickly, which can be helpful in certain types of games.
rapid_trigger.hint_only_works_after_trigger: If the key has been fully released, it must first be pressed to your configured Actuation distance of {{ mm }}mm.

dynamic_reset_travel.description: If the key is triggered, reset as long as the specified distance is released.
dynamic_reset_travel.title: Dynamic reset travel

dynamic_trigger_travel.description: If the key is not triggered, trigger as long as the specified distance is pressed.
dynamic_trigger_travel.title: Dynamic trigger travel

rapid_trigger.hint_select_keys_first: Please select the key you want to set the Rapid Trigger first.

trigger_travel.title: Actuation distance
trigger_travel.description: How far a key needs to be pressed to trigger.
trigger_travel.hint_select_keys_first: Please select the key you want to set the actuation distance first.
trigger_travel.hint_too_low_is_meaningless: Lowering the actuation distance further is meaningless, as it only affects how far the key needs to be pressed after being fully released.
trigger_travel.hint_too_low_is_unstable: Under the current settings, releasing a key may cause it to trigger again.
trigger_travel.hint_too_low_is_unstable_tooltip:
Vibrations in the switch or stabilizers are unavoidable when they hit the top.

Forcefully pressing and quickly releasing, or using keys with stabilizers (e.g., the spacebar), results in relatively larger vibrations.

If the vibration amplitude exceeds the actuation distance, it will cause the key to trigger again.

rapid_trigger_in_full_travel.title: Effective only within Actuation distance
rapid_trigger_in_full_travel.description: When turned on, once the key is released beyond {{travel}}mm (the Actuation distance you set), it must be pressed again to {{travel}}mm to trigger again; when turned off, Rapid Trigger remains effective unless the key is fully released.

description.global: The displayed settings are the settings of all keys that are set to "Use global settings". If you want to modify certain keys individually, select them first.
description.individual: The displayed settings are the settings of selected keys.

key_test.title: Key test
key_test.description: Tests the key code received by the operating system.
key_test.hint: This tool is intended for general-purpose key testing and can be used with any keyboard, but it is not suitable for specialized purposes such as latency testing.
key_test.hint_limited_by_browser: Due to the limitations of the browser environment, some keys cannot be tested and the obtained time may not be accurate.
key_test.hint_troubleshooting: If you want to investigate or report to the developer the issue of chattering or missed keystrokes, please "{{ target }}".
key_test.hint_unfocused: The browser is not in focus and cannot get key events.

unsupported_browser.continue_description: You can also choose to continue exploring RAKKA Keyboard Configurator in order to understand its features. However, you may encounter problems with pages not displaying properly, and you may not be able to connect a keyboard properly.
unsupported_browser.description: RAKKA Keyboard Configurator is built using WebHID and some modern technologies, but unfortunately, the browser you are using does not support these technologies. Note that browsers such as FireFox, Safari, etc. are not supported as they do not support WebHID.
unsupported_browser.title: You are using an unsupported browser
unsupported_browser.other_possibly_supported_browser: Other browsers based on Chromium {{ version }} ({{ date }}) (possibly supported)

switches.hint_series: This a series of switches, including multiple models.
switches.hint_bad_installation_causes_abnormal: Improper installation may cause key input issues
switches.hint_pins_are_thinker: This switch has thicker pins, while the PCB is designed with smaller holes to accommodate more common switch types. Proper installation may require fully disassembling the keyboard; otherwise, incomplete insertion could lead to issues like chattering or disconnection. However, for prebuilt keyboards, this may void the warranty—please proceed at your own discretion.

metadata.disclaimer: Data comes from manufacturers’ public information
metadata.link: Visit information webpage from the manufacturer

legacy.title: (Legacy)
legacy.description: Used by early firmware version, only retained so as not to disrupt users' existing habits.

gateron_ks20.title: Magnetic White Switch
gateron_ks20.series_description: Some other models of switches have the same parameters as it, including but not limited to Magnetic Orange Switch, and Wooting Lekker switches.

gateron_ks20u.title: Dual-Rail Magnetic Switch
gateron_ks20u.series_description: Some other models of switches have the same parameters as it, including but not limited to Dual-Rail Magnetic Orange Switch.

choose_switch.title: Choose switch

confirm_dialog.title: Change to {{switch_name}}?
confirm_dialog.content:
The selected keys will be recalibrated according to {{switch_name}}. Please do not touch the keys for a few seconds.

If the switches triggers abnormally, please read the cautions on the left.

hint_choose_switch_for_key_requires_firm.title: Changing the switch will affect all the keys
hint_choose_switch_for_key_requires_firm.description: Your firmware version is too low to support different switches for different keys. No matter which keys you choose, it will affect all the keys.

choose_switch.hint_no_keys_selected: Please choose the keys you want to change the switch first.
choose_switch.hint_most_keys_switch: Most of the keys uses {{ switch }}.

changing_switch_on_soft_plate_warning.title: To replace the switch yourself…
changing_switch_on_soft_plate_warning.description:
Hall Effect keyboards require the switches to be securely fixed on the PCB. Otherwise, it will lead to false triggers and resets.

Please ensure that the switches are firmly installed, and if necessary, disassemble the internal components to press them tightly into place.

DO NOT use plates made of soft materials or those with slots.

This is because newer switches usually have thinner pins, which will not fit securely into the holes on the PCB. With such plates, the switch will essentially be floating above the PCB, causing serious incorrect readings.

changing_switch_powered_on.title: Re-plugin the switch while powered on…
changing_switch_powered_on.description: Please ensure that the installation is secure and reset the runtime calibration data.

wizard.title: Allow the browser to connect the device
wizard.description: Your browser should show a dialog below the address bar (as shown in the example). Click on the device name in the list to select the device and then click "Connect".

dialog.title: {{hostname}} wants to connect to a HID device

wizard.replug_hint: If you cannot see your device or it keeps connecting, replug the device and try again.
wizard.cannot_connect_button: I still cannot connect my device
wizard.cannot_connect_hint_firmware_update_fail: If your device is accidentally disconnected or fails during the firmware upgrade process, it will stay in Recovery mode. Different devices will use different ways to indicate that they are in recovery mode, such as a solid indicator light. Don't panic, you can recover by updating the firmware again.

profile.title: Profiles

standalone_keymap.title: Standalone keymap
standalone_keymap.description: When on, this profile has independent key mapping settings. When off, this profile uses the keymap settings of profile 1.

rename.title: Rename
rename.hint_empty: The profile name cannot be empty.
rename.hint_too_long: The profile name can be up to {{ length }} characters long.

how_to_switch.title: How to switch profile
how_to_switch.description:
Switch the profile used by the keyboard: In Keymap, bind keys in Profile category to the location you want, then press the key on the keyboard. On some keyboards, the default "Layer 1" + QWER is to switch profile 1234.

Edit Profile: Click the profile you want to edit.

profile.hint_keyboard_current_profile: The keyboard is currently on this profile
profile.hint_keyboard_switch_profile: Under your remap settings, press {{ combination }} can switch to this profile
profile.hint_profile_key_not_found: The key to switch to this profile is not found, you can bind the profile key to the location you want
profile.hint_editing_profile_changes_for_keyboar: Due to a change in the configuration profile currently in use by the keyboard, the profile being edited has been switched.

hint_editing_profile_is_not_current.title: You are editing a non-current profile
hint_editing_profile_is_not_current.description:
You won't be able to see or use the changes you've made until you switch to this profile.

The keyboard supports multiple profiles to accommodate different usage scenarios. For example, you can set different actuation distances and Rapid Trigger settings for typing and gaming, and use distinct lighting effects to differentiate them.

You can find the profile switch key by hovering your mouse over the profile name. This key is fully customizable.

active.name: Active
active.hint: The keyboard is currently using this profile.

inactive.name: Inactive
inactive.hint: The keyboard is not using this profile. You can switch to it by pressing the corresponding shortcut key combination.

on_board_profiles.title: On-board profiles
on_board_profiles.description: On-board profiles are stored on the keyboard and can be used at any time, regardless of which device the keyboard is connected to.

pwa.app_ready_to_work_offline: RAKKA Keyboard Configurator is ready to use offline
pwa.update_available: RAKKA Keyboard Configurator has a new version available

windows_dynamic_lighting.title: Dynamic Lighting

description.title: What is Dynamic Lighting?
description.content: Dynamic Lighting allows you to control all supported keyboards, mice, and other peripherals in Windows settings or third-party control programs to achieve a unified lighting style. This feature is available on Windows 11 23H2 or later.
description.open_windows_settings: Open Dynamic Lighting page in Windows Settings

supported_third_party_software.title: Third-party software that supports Dynamic Lighting

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: The above links point to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the content of these websites.

windows_dynamic_lighting.hint_not_supported: It seems that Dynamic Lighting is not supported on your system.
windows_dynamic_lighting.hint_supported: Dynamic Lighting is supported on your system.

lighting.hint_static_is_override: This effect has its own color which will override the color you set.
lighting.hint_left_click: Left-click a key to set its color for the "Static" effect under "Base effect".
lighting.hint_middle_click: Middle-click to sample its color to the color picker.
lighting.set_color_for_selected_keys_tooltip: Color will take effect when "Base effect" is set to "Static".

enforce_indicator_on_profile_change.title: Enforce indicators on profile change
enforce_indicator_on_profile_change.description: Forces indicators (such as the CapsLock indicator) to turn on within a few seconds after a profile change. By setting different indicator lights for different profiles, you can distinguish which profile is the current one.

sleep_mode.title: Sleep mode
sleep_mode.description: If no keys are pressed for a specified period of time, the lighting will dim or turn off. Note that if the computer enters sleep or shutdown mode, the lighting will turn off directly, regardless of the following settings.
sleep_mode.off: Turn off after a specified time

estimated_power_consumption.title: Estimated power consumption and heat
estimated_power_consumption.description: This value is an estimate. Actual power consumption may vary depending on lighting effects, colors, and other factors. For example, displaying white consumes the most power.

high_brightness_warning.title: High brightness in use
high_brightness_warning.description: Further increasing the brightness will significantly raise power consumption and heat, but the perceived brightness by the human eye will not increase accordingly.
high_brightness_warning.joke_warmer_note: Your keyboard might turn into a hand warmer.

swift_flow.title: Swift Flow
swift_flow.description: {{name}} provides additional mechanisms to determine whether a key is triggered. First, {{trigger_travel}} or {{rapid_trigger}} determines whether the key is pressed, and then {{name}} determines whether the key should be triggered. Note that if the key matches the reset condition of {{trigger_travel}} or {{rapid_trigger}}, the button will always be reset.
swift_flow.hint_select_two_keys: Please select two keys at the keyboard above.
swift_flow.hint_no_keys_selected: This combination will not works since keys are not selected yet.
swift_flow.hint_last_input_banned: "{{priority}}" has been banned by {{games}} because it is considered as automation. To avoid violations, please do not use it.

depth.title: Depth priority
depth.description: If both keys are pressed, only trigger the key that pressed deeper.

last_input.title: Last input priority
last_input.description: Only trigger the key that was pressed later.

absolute.title: Absolute priority ({{key}})
absolute.description: If {{keyA}} is pressed, {{keyB}} will never trigger no matter it is pressed or not.

neutral.title: Neutral
neutral.description: If both of the keys are pressed, trigger none of them.

depth_priority_sensitivity.title: Depth priority sensitivity
depth_priority_sensitivity.description: The threshold for determining whether the pressing depth of one key exceeds that of another. This is to avoid the key being triggered repeatedly when the pressing depth is very close.

requires_full_cycle.title: Requires full cycle
requires_full_cycle.description: If a triggered key is reset by this function, the key must first be released to the point where it is no longer considered pressed before it can be triggered by pressing it again.

both_when_bottoming.title: Trigger both when bottoming
both_when_bottoming.description: Force trigger both of the keys when all of them are pressed and the key is bottomed out.
both_when_bottoming.bottoming_threshold: Pressing distance at the bottom of {{ mm }}mm is considered as bottoming out.

swift_flow.hint_cautious: Use this feature with caution in competitive environments to avoid penalties or bans.

about.title: About
about.description: RAKKA Keyboard Configurator is a web-based tool for configuring your RAKKA devices.

window_too_small.title: Oops, it’s too small!
window_too_small.description1: Your browser window size is too small to display all content.
window_too_small.description2: Please try adjusting the window size and zoom ratio.
window_too_small.button: I don't care, you calculated it wrong!

hint_firmware_version_too_low: Your firmware version is too low to support this feature.

rapid_trigger.hint_dont_too_aggressive: We do not recommend setting the options as low as possible.
rapid_trigger.hint_dont_too_aggressive_hint: Due to unavoidable objective factors, overly low settings require stable operation, or abnormal key triggering may occur. We do not attempt to circumvent these objective factors because doing so would require significantly sacrificing response speed (latency).
rapid_trigger.hint_dont_too_aggressive_tooltip_1: The keyboard estimates distance by detecting the strength of the magnetic field. It cannot detect other factors such as switch wobble or material vibrations.
rapid_trigger.hint_dont_too_aggressive_tooltip_2: Human hands cannot move in a perfectly vertical and stable motion—slight wobbling may occur. Clearly, if parameters are set too low, even minor tilts can result in missed keypresses.
rapid_trigger.hint_dont_too_aggressive_tooltip_3: Deformation and vibration inevitably occur when pressing the switch, PCB, plate, or stabilizers. When the parameters are set extremely low, these deformations and vibrations may be interpreted as key activations.
rapid_trigger.hint_dont_too_aggressive_tooltip_4: We believe the most important feature of Hall Effect keyboards is the response speed (low latency)—the keyboard should react as quickly as possible to even the smallest changes. Sacrificing response time by multiples—dozens or even hundreds of times—just to maintain 'stability' under extremely low settings is counterproductive.
rapid_trigger.hint_key_tracker: The Key Tracking Tool allows you to view the key press distance in real time. It can help you identify the cause of abnormal key behavior and plays a decisive role when reporting issues or requesting after-sales support.
rapid_trigger.hint_too_aggressive: The current settings are starting to be affected by unavoidable objective factors and require relatively stable operation to function properly. Please find a configuration that suits your actual usage.
rapid_trigger.hint_extreme: The current setting is extreme and requires exceptionally stable operation to function properly. You can imagine the key as a vertical needle—it must be pressed almost perfectly vertically to avoid abnormal behavior.
rapid_trigger.hint_large_keys: This phenomenon becomes more noticeable when keys are hit hard, especially larger keys, as they are more affected by vibrations.
rapid_trigger.hint_find_most_suitable: Finding the most suitable settings requires continuous experimentation.
rapid_trigger.hint_downgraded_since_lacks_bottom_calib: Due to the lack of manual bottom calibration, the minimal value is {{ mm }}.
rapid_trigger.hint_works_only_at_bottom: Acts as {{ mm }} for non-bottoming area.
rapid_trigger.hint_always_trigger_when_bottoming_is_on: ‘Always trigger when bottoming out’ is enabled. When the key is in the bottom region, slight upward movement will not cause the keyboard to respond. In other words, it's equivalent to having a larger reset distance in that region.

reset_distance_less_or_close_to_trigger_.title: Unintended key release may occur
reset_distance_less_or_close_to_trigger_.reason: The currently set reset distance is less than or only slightly greater than the trigger distance. Considering possible switch wobble, re-triggering after reset may require a perfectly vertical press, which is difficult in practical use.
reset_distance_less_or_close_to_trigger_.hint_changed: The reset distance has been automatically adjusted to {{ mm }}mm based on the trigger distance setting.

device_management.hint_connect_to_a_device_first: Please connect to a device first

auto_connect.title: Auto connect
auto_connect.description: Automatically connect to the last connected device when the page is loaded

hint_this_option_is_global: This option is global and does not vary from profile to profile.
hint_options_are_global: These options are global and does not vary from profile to profile.
hint_options_are_individual: These option are varies from profile to profile. For example, you can set different trigger travels for typing profile and gaming profile, and then distinguish them by setting different lighting.

regional_site.hint_based_on_local_information: The region is inferred locally based on your browser's language, time zone, and other information.

visit_global_site_in_mainland_china.title: You Are Visiting the Global Site
visit_global_site_in_mainland_china.summary: If you are in Mainland China, please visit the site tailored for Mainland China users for better access speed.

visit_mainland_china_site_in_other_regio.title: You May Not Be in Mainland China
visit_mainland_china_site_in_other_regio.summary: If you are not in Mainland China, please visit the global site for better access speed.

hint_do_not_use_hub: Using a USB Hub to connect devices may result in degraded performance or unstable connections.

auto_choose.title: Auto choose
auto_choose.description:
Automatically select layout options based on your installed keys.

If you change the installed keys, you will need to Retry auto choose.
If the detection is incorrect, you may need to select manually.

manual_choose_will_disable_auto_choose.title: Manual choose will disable auto choose
manual_choose_will_disable_auto_choose.description: If you manually select layout options, the auto choose feature will be disabled. If you change the key of your installation in the future, you will need to manually select the layout options.

hint_this_option_requires_a_newer_versio: This option requires a newer version of the firmware.
hint_this_function_requires_a_newer_vers: This function requires a newer version of the firmware.

error.timeout_when_communicating_with_the_devi: Timeout when communicating with the device
error.error_when_communicating_with_the_device: Error when communicating with the device
error.bad_cable: One possible reason could be the quality of the USB cable, which may cause an unstable connection or reduced connection speed (preventing the device from operating at USB 2.0 high speed).
error.contact_us: Please retry with another USB cale. If the issue persists, please email us at {{ email }} for assistance.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.hint: This tool is used for self-investigation or reporting chattering or missed keystrokes issues to the developer.
troubleshooting.hint_stay_in_this_page_will_slow_down: Note, staying on this page will slightly slows down response time.

key_tracker.title: Key Tracking
key_tracker.hint_lag: Due to the large amount of data and browser platform limitations, this tool may experience noticeable lag. It is recommended to stop tracking once you've observed the necessary data to minimize lag.

texts.description: This tool allows you to track the pressing distance of a key in real time and visualize it in a chart for observation and analysis.
texts.limitation_intro: Due to fundamental limitations, the keyboard itself cannot distinguish 'normal pressing' from the following objectively existing conditions (including but not limited to). When parameters are set extremely low (e.g., around 0.01mm or even lower), the impact of these conditions becomes very significant.

shaking.tooltip: Movement causes the magnet inside the switch to tilt, altering the detected magnetic force. The keyboard cannot tell whether this change is part of a 'normal press'.

press_force_change.text: Force changes after the key bottoms out
press_force_change.tooltip: Materials such as the switch can experience slight deformation under pressure, causing minor shifts in the magnet’s position. The keyboard cannot tell whether this change is part of a 'normal press'.

hard_hit.text: Pressing the key with greater force (compared to a 'normal press')
hard_hit.tooltip: During pressing, especially with hard hits, components like the switch and keycap may deform or vibrate, causing the magnet inside the switch to move slightly. The keyboard cannot tell whether this change is part of a 'normal press'.

texts.extreme_param_warning: Since the above factors are unavoidable during manual operation, unintended key releases under extremely low settings are considered normal and do not indicate an issue with the keyboard itself.
texts.reproduce_tips: You can simulate in-game operations and compare them with more vertical and stable presses to better understand the differences between various pressing styles.
texts.design_philosophy_intro: We believe that the most important feature of Hall Effect keyboards is their response speed (low latency).
texts.design_philosophy: Our products (especially the RAKKA 80 Edge and later) are designed to faithfully and sensitively reflect user actions in real time, even when those actions are influenced by the objective factors mentioned above. Trying to eliminate these factors by sacrificing latency—often by tens or even hundreds of times—ultimately slows down the keyboard’s response to normal operations, which completely defeats the purpose.

trigger_log.delta_tooltip: The time difference between the last trigger/reset event and the current event. However, the time is acquired from the host, so it may not be accurate.
trigger_log.hint_scroll: You can zoom in and out of the chart using the mouse scroll wheel to closely observe changes during triggers or resets. Unintended triggers and resets caused by the mentioned objective factors usually happen very quickly and subtly, requiring zooming in to be properly seen.

key_tracker.hint_scan_rate: This speed does not directly reflect scan rate (how many times the key is scanned per second), as for RAKKA 80 and later products, these data may already be preprocessed (from more raw data).

debounce.hint_latency_increase_to_at_the_worst_sc: The keyboard may fail to respond promptly to key changes. In the worst-case scenario, latency may increase by up to {{ times }} times.
debounce.hint_worse_than_level0: Using this level with extreme parameter settings may result in slower response (higher latency) than using Level 0 with more moderate parameters.
debounce.hint_about_latency_test: Latency test methods that instantly change sensor output are inaccurate, as human fingers cannot move that quickly. Such methods will only produce results that are better—or even significantly better—than actual real-world performance.
debounce.hint_user_actions_are_inaccurate: Stable behavior cannot be guaranteed under extremely low thresholds (e.g., 0.0xmm), as the switch may wobble during pressing, and the keyboard cannot distinguish between a normal finger lift and unintended wobble.

filter_strength.title: Filter strength
filter_strength.description: Filtering algorithms can make key presses more 'stable', but the trade-off is a significant reduction in responsiveness, resulting in higher latency.

always_trigger_when_bottoming.title: Always trigger when bottoming out
always_trigger_when_bottoming.description: When a key bottoms out, finger wobble or unconscious release of pressure can cause fluctuations in the detected pressing distance. If the parameter is set too low, such changes may be misinterpreted as a key release.
always_trigger_when_bottoming.reason: This issue cannot be avoided without compromise. The keyboard infers pressing distance solely from magnetic strength, so it cannot determine whether a change is caused by intentional finger movement or by wobble or release.
always_trigger_when_bottoming.trade_off: Enabling this feature will cause the keyboard to ignore small changes in pressing distance near the bottom. In other words, it acts as if a higher parameter value is set.

exceed_switch_limit.title: Unexpected key release may be normal
exceed_switch_limit.reason: The configured value is lower than or close to the distance variation caused by wobble in the current switch ({{ switch_name }}).
exceed_switch_limit.unless: Unless every keystroke is guaranteed to be stable and perfectly vertical, unexpected release is considered normal and not a keyboard defect.

too_low.title: Current settings may cause unexpected key release
too_low.reason: The current settings are too low. Our keyboard responds faithfully and sensitively to data changes, rather than achieving so-called 'stability' by drastically sacrificing latency.

parameters_are_too_low.button_why: Why? Isn’t this something the keyboard should handle?

avoid_vibration.title: Mitigate the impact of vibration
avoid_vibration.description:
During key press and release, vibrations occur in the switch stem, keycap, and other components—especially when pressed with greater force. If parameters are set too low, these vibrations may be mistakenly detected as a keypress.
This feature attempts to mitigate such effects without impacting latency.
avoid_vibration.consequences_of_toggle_off: Disabling this feature may result in multiple triggers from a single press. This is more likely to occur when parameters are set extremely low or when pressing with high force.

avoid_overshoot.title: Mitigate the impact of bottom-out rebound
avoid_overshoot.description:
When a key bottoms out, deformation in the switch and other materials may cause the detected press depth to briefly overshoot before settling—this is known as 'rebound.' The effect is more pronounced with heavy presses. If the parameter is set very low, this can lead to false key releases.
This feature attempts to prevent such issues without affecting latency.
avoid_overshoot.hint_requires_bottom_calibration: This feature only works on keys that have been manually calibrated for bottom-out position, as it relies on an approximate bottom-out reference.
avoid_overshoot.consequences_of_toggle_off: Disabling this feature may result in unintended key releases. This is more likely to occur with low parameter settings or strong key presses.

nkro.title: N-Key Rollover
nkro.description: N-Key Rollover (NKRO) allows you to press more than 6 keys simultaneously.
nkro.description_auto_detect: NKRO does not work properly on some BIOS or gaming consoles. We use a special method to detect whether the connected host supports NKRO. If it does, the keyboard will automatically enable NKRO. If it does not, the keyboard will automatically disable NKRO.
nkro.hint_toggle_by_binding_toggle_keys: For special needs, you can toggle NKRO by binding the toggle keys in the Keymap section.

priority_keys.title: Key scan priority
priority_keys.description: This feature allows you to assign higher priority to specific key combinations to improve their response speed. Accordingly, if a key combination is set to higher priority, the response speed of other key combinations in the same area will be reduced. Naturally, the more key combinations you select in the same area, the smaller the improvement in response speed.
priority_keys.hint_unable_to_control_at_pre_key_level: It is not possible to precisely control the priority of each individual key, as the key combinations and areas are determined by hardware design.
